TikTok ban: Biden hands over Chinese app's fate to Trump before White House exit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biden Hands Over TikTok's Fate to Trump Ahead of Exit

Publication Date: Date not specified | Source: Hindustan Times

As President Biden prepares to leave office, he will not enforce a TikTok ban enacted by Congress, transferring the decision to President-elect Trump, who has previously expressed both support and opposition to the app.

  • Biden will not enforce the upcoming TikTok ban before his departure.
  • The law requires TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to divest by January 19.
  • Trump's administration may work to extend the deadline for a potential deal.
  • Senate leaders showed bipartisan support for extending the deadline to avoid disruption for users.
  • The Supreme Court is considering a legal challenge to the TikTok ban.
Chuck Schumer stated, “It’s clear that more time is needed to find an American buyer and not disrupt the lives and livelihoods of millions of Americans.”

As TikTok's future remains uncertain, it will be crucial to watch how the new administration handles the app's potential ban and its implications for users and the digital landscape.
newTitle: Biden Hands Over TikTok's Fate to Trump Ahead of Exit

title: 124 year-old woman who outlived her children shares the secret of her long life - The Times of India
summary:
124 Year-Old Woman Shares Secrets to Longevity

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Health Wellness Journal

This article explores the remarkable life of a 124-year-old woman who has outlived her children. She shares her insights on what contributed to her longevity and happiness.

  • The woman attributes her long life to a positive mindset and daily exercise.
  • She emphasizes the importance of maintaining strong family ties and friendships.
  • Her diet includes traditional foods rich in nutrients.
“Every day is a gift, and I’ve learned to live in the moment,” she said.

The insights from this extraordinary centenarian offer inspiration for those curious about the secrets to a long and fulfilling life.
newTitle: 124 Year-Old Woman Shares Secrets to Longevity

Indian national, Sai Varshith Kandula, sentenced to 8 years for attempted attack on White House - The Hindu
summary:
Indian National Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted Attack on White House

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Indian national Sai Varshith Kandula was sentenced to eight years for an attempted attack on the White House with a rented truck, aiming to overthrow the U.S. government.

  • Kandula pled guilty to willful injury to U.S. property.
  • He drove a truck onto a sidewalk and crashed into security barriers near the White House.
  • He brandished a Nazi flag after the crash, promoting a dictatorship.
  • Kandula caused an estimated $4,322 in damage.
  • He had planned the attack for weeks, trying to acquire armed guards and larger vehicles.
“Kandula's intent was to replace the democratically elected government with a dictatorship fueled by ideology of Nazi Germany,” stated the Department of Justice.

This incident highlights significant security concerns and the urgency of addressing radical ideologies.
newTitle: Indian National Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted Attack on White House

title: Netanyahu says deal to release Hamas-held hostages has been reached - The Hindu
summary:
Netanyahu Announces Deal for Release of Hamas-held Hostages

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The office of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a deal has been reached for the release of hostages held by Hamas, with a political-security cabinet convening to discuss the details.

  • Netanyahu's office confirmed agreements on a deal to release the hostages.
  • The families of the hostages have been informed and preparations are being made for their return.
  • If approved, the truce would start on Sunday, enabling the exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners.
  • The deal was mediated by Qatar and the United States, announced on Wednesday.
“The Prime Minister ordered the political-security cabinet to convene tomorrow (Friday). The government will then convene to approve the deal,” Netanyahu’s office stated.

Should this deal be approved, it could mark a significant step towards a ceasefire and a resolution to the ongoing conflict.
newTitle: Netanyahu Announces Deal for Release of Hamas-held Hostages

Pakistan Eclipses Indian Navy In AIP-Submarine Tech! Set To Widen The Gap With Chinese Hangor-Class Subs - EurAsian Times
summary:
Pakistan Eclipses Indian Navy In AIP-Submarine Tech! Set To Widen The Gap With Chinese Hangor-Class Subs

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

This article discusses how Pakistan is making significant advancements in its naval capabilities, specifically through the acquisition of Air Independent Propulsion (AIP) technology for its submarine fleet, contrasting it with the Indian Navy's current limitations.

  • Pakistan has successfully integrated AIP technology in its Agosta-90B submarines.
  • The Hangor-class submarines, expected to enter service by the late 2020s to early 2030s, will enhance Pakistan's naval strength to 11 AIP-equipped submarines.
  • Despite financial constraints, Pakistan continues to bolster its naval fleet to compete with India.
  • Admiral Naveed Ashraf highlighted the operational improvements due to the Hangor-class submarines.
  • India is still developing AIP technology and faces delays in its submarine modernization program.
“The project is proceeding as per the timeline. We expect that these submarines will join the Pakistan Navy fleet very soon.” - Admiral Naveed Ashraf

The growing naval capabilities of Pakistan, particularly through Chinese collaboration and technological advancements, pose new challenges in regional security dynamics, especially against the backdrop of India's slower progress in submarine technology.
newTitle: Pakistan Eclipses Indian Navy In AIP-Submarine Tech: A New Era in Naval Capabilities

title: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu PM Netanyahu says Israel-Hamas deal to release hostages held in Gaza reached - Hindustan Times
summary:
Israel and Hamas Reach Hostage Deal, Ceasefire Likely

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: HT News

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that a deal to return hostages held in the Gaza Strip has been reached, marking a significant step towards a ceasefire after 15 months of conflict.

  • Netanyahu plans to convene his security Cabinet to approve the agreement.
  • The deal aims to pause the ongoing war and facilitate the release of hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.
  • Since the conflict began on October 7, 2023, significant casualties have occurred on both sides.
  • Hamas has denied claims that it reneged on parts of the agreement.
  • The ceasefire agreement faces opposition from Netanyahu's far-right coalition partners.
“The State of Israel is committed to achieving all the goals of the war, including the return of all our hostages – both living and dead,” - Prime Minister's Office

This agreement could potentially alleviate further violence and allow displaced Palestinians to return to their homes, emphasizing the fragile state of ceasefire negotiations.
newTitle: Israel and Hamas Reach Hostage Deal, Ceasefire Likely

title: Israel strikes Gaza and accuses Hamas of backtracking on deal - The Hindu
summary:
Israel Strikes Gaza and Accuses Hamas of Backtracking on Deal

Publication Date: January 16, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Israel conducted airstrikes on Gaza, accusing Hamas of backtracking on a ceasefire and hostage release agreement that was to take effect on January 19, 2025.

  • The proposed truce involved an exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners.
  • Accusations arose from Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu about Hamas reneging on the agreement.
  • Over 75 were reported dead in Gaza due to the airstrikes following the announcement of the deal.
  • The ongoing conflict has resulted in significant casualties, with about 46,788 reported deaths in Gaza since the outbreak of hostilities.
  • Public opinion in both Gaza and Israel reflected mixed feelings, swinging between hope for peace and anguish over continued violence.
“It was the happiest night since October 7 until we received the news of the martyrdom of 40 people from the Alloush family,” said a resident of Gaza.

The article discusses the precarious situation as efforts continue to stabilize the truce, balancing between political negotiations and the humanitarian crisis exacerbated by the recent escalations.
newTitle: Israel Strikes Gaza Amid Accusations of Hamas Backtracking on Ceasefire Deal

title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Live Updates: 77 more Gazans killed in Israeli strikes after ceasefire deal as delayed cabinet meet likely Friday - The Indian Express
summary:
Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Live Updates: 77 more Gazans killed in Israeli strikes after ceasefire deal as delayed cabinet meet likely Friday

Publication Date: November 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Israeli cabinet is set to meet on Friday to ratify a ceasefire and hostage exchange deal after accusations against Hamas for seeking last-minute concessions. The ceasefire aims to bring relief for both hostages and displaced residents in Gaza.

  • A three-phase ceasefire agreement is underway, focusing on the release of hostages and Palestinian prisoners.
  • The war, ignited by Hamas' attack on October 7, 2023, has resulted in over 46,000 Palestinian deaths.
  • Reportedly 1,200 Israelis were killed and 250 taken hostage in the initial attack.
“The Israeli cabinet will not convene until the mediators notify Israel that Hamas has accepted all elements of the agreement.” - Benjamin Netanyahu

This ongoing situation highlights the severe toll on both sides as negotiations continue, with significant repercussions for future peace and stability in the region.
newTitle: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Live Updates: Rising Casualties Amid Ongoing Negotiations

summary:
Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal nears finalisation as disputes over prisoner release resolved: Report

Date: January 16, 2025

The final disputes preventing a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas have reportedly been resolved. The matter is expected to be settled shortly, allowing for the ratification of the ceasefire.

  • The disputes revolved around the identities of prisoners that Hamas seeks to have released.
  • Israel postponed a cabinet meeting that was intended to ratify the ceasefire, blaming Hamas for the delay.

This is a developing story.

summary:
Why Michelle Obama Is Skipping Trump's Inauguration

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

Michelle Obama’s absence from Donald Trump’s inauguration has led to speculation about her marriage to Barack Obama. Some speculate divorce while others suggest her absence is due to mourning her mother.

  • Michelle Obama will not attend the inauguration on January 20.
  • Speculations about divorce arise due to their recent separateness at public events.
  • A source indicates her absence is a deliberate choice, reflecting her feelings about Trump.
“Her absence speaks volumes,” a source close to the Obamas commented.

title: TikTok CEO plans to attend Trump inauguration - TechCrunch
summary:
TikTok CEO Plans to Attend Trump Inauguration

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: TechCrunch

As TikTok’s fate hangs in the balance, TikTok CEO, Shou Chew, is planning to attend President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration on Monday. The executive will join Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, and Elon Musk on the dais.

  • Trump's previous administration initiated calls to ban TikTok due to security concerns.
  • During his 2024 campaign, Trump promised to save the app after realizing its popularity among young users.
  • Chew's presence at the inauguration comes as TikTok nears a potential shutdown in the U.S. on January 19, pending a Supreme Court decision.
  • Trump has openly discussed his favorable experiences with TikTok in reaching audiences during his campaign.
The Supreme Court is expected to rule soon on a law that could effectively ban TikTok in the U.S.

This significant event highlights the intertwining of social media and politics, especially as TikTok faces potential legal challenges that could alter its future in the U.S.
newTitle: TikTok CEO Plans to Attend Trump Inauguration Amid App Uncertainty

44 Pakistanis among 50 feared dead in tragic boat disaster on way to Spain - The Express Tribune
summary:
Tragic Boat Disaster Claims Lives of 44 Pakistanis on Journey to Spain

Publication Date: January 12, 2024

Source: The Tribune

A tragic incident involving migrants attempting to reach Spain from West Africa may have claimed the lives of up to 50 people, including 44 Pakistanis, according to the migrant rights group Walking Borders.

  • The boat departed from Mauritania on January 2 with 86 migrants on board.
  • Moroccan authorities rescued 36 people from the boat days after it went missing.
  • The migrants were attempting to reach the Canary Islands, a key destination for many.
  • Walking Borders reported a record number of deaths among migrants in early 2024.
  • PM Shehbaz Sharif ordered strict action against human trafficking following the tragedy.
  • The Foreign Ministry activated its Crisis Management Unit to assist affected families.
"The Atlantic cannot continue to be the graveyard of Africa," - Fernando Clavijo, regional leader of the Canary Islands.

This incident has prompted widespread outrage and calls for urgent action to prevent further tragedies involving migrants.
newTitle: Tragic Boat Disaster Claims Lives of 44 Pakistanis on Journey to Spain
